intro: Agapetes fasciculiflora, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in clusters, giving the plant its common name. Agapetes fasciculiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
